channel.title: Helpp retrieving a text from another website
channel.description: Hey guys i was wondering if you could help me with something.. I'm trying to make a UI web page for me, and i was wonderhing how could i retrieve my followers for example on Instagram so i can display the number on my webpage.

item.title: Helpp retrieving a text from another website
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Death Style:

or you could just scrape it that way since it’s public I guess

Assuming all of the data is generated on the server before it is sent to the client, yes. If anything is done through JS it becomes too cumbersome to scrape all of that data just to get something simple like your followers. This is the reason that these sites create these APIs.

@OP:
If you’ve never used an API like that, its definitely time to learn. They are very helpful and can save you a lot of time.

Read full topic
item.source: Helpp retrieving a text from another website

item.title: Helpp retrieving a text from another website
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:10, topic:546208”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=665104.msg4446221#msg4446221 date=1408939510]

nvm lol wrong section

i had posted how to do it with java but didnt realize it was web design section, sry
[/quote]That’s ok man! That would actually work. It satisfies what he’s asking, right? Java can be used for web applications too!

ok well in that case

URL oracle = new URL("http://www.instagram.com"); URLConnection yc = oracle.openConnection(); BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader( yc.getInputStream())); String inputLine; while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) { System.out.println(inputLine); }

this snippet of code should help you find whatever line you’re specifically looking for

edit:

used it on my instagram and found this

pretty sure that’s what you’re looking for. so just put your instagram link in for the URL[/quote]thanks i’ll mess with it to see how it works

Read full topic

item.title: Helpp retrieving a text from another website
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:6, topic:546208”][quote author=asshole_rule link=topic=665104.msg4446149#msg4446149 date=1408915447]
nvm lol wrong section

i had posted how to do it with java but didnt realize it was web design section, sry
[/quote]That’s ok man! That would actually work. It satisfies what he’s asking, right? Java can be used for web applications too![/quote]

ok well in that case

URL oracle = new URL("http://www.instagram.com"); URLConnection yc = oracle.openConnection(); BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader( yc.getInputStream())); String inputLine; while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) { System.out.println(inputLine); }

this snippet of code should help you find whatever line you’re specifically looking for

edit:

used it on my instagram and found this

pretty sure that’s what you’re looking for. so just put your instagram link in for the URL

Read full topic
item.source: Helpp retrieving a text from another website

item.title: Helpp retrieving a text from another website
item.dc:creator: @Death_Style Death Style
item.description:
@Death_Style wrote:

basically you need to register an application to get a key that allows you to use the API. sites that use oauth include tumblr, twitter, facebook.

you’ll have to authenticate your instagram account to retrieve this information. if you understand how the API works you can set this up with your server and easily request the information on behalf of the account you authenticated.

Read full topic
item.source: Helpp retrieving a text from another website

item.title: Helpp retrieving a text from another website
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Strucker, post:7, topic:546208”][quote author=Death Style link=topic=665104.msg4446216#msg4446216 date=1408934892]
do you have an oauth key
[/quote]I’m kinda too nob on this, what do you mean by that?
is it this?https://api.instagram.com/oauth/authorize/?client_id=CLIENT-ID&redirect_uri=REDIRECT-URI&response_type=code[/quote]
Believe he’s talking about: http://instagram.com/developer/authentication/
Also: http://jelled.com/instagram/access-token

Read full topic

item.title: Helpp retrieving a text from another website
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

http://instagram.com/developer/endpoints/users/

https://api.instagram.com/v1/users/1574083/?access_token=ACCESS-TOKEN [code]{ "data": { "id": "1574083", "username": "snoopdogg", "full_name": "Snoop Dogg", "profile_picture": "http://distillery.s3.amazonaws.com/profiles/profile_1574083_75sq_1295469061.jpg", "bio": "This is my bio", "website": "http://snoopdogg.com", "counts": { "media": 1320, "follows": 420, "followed_by": 3410 } }[/code] Get basic information about a user.
